communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or reports, body cam footage, audio or video recordings related to any incidents that GPD has responded to at 4105 Lenox Park Drive, Buford, GA 30519. I am requesting all records from the past ten years, with the exception of the incident on July 3, 2021 when Heather Johnston died. I have already obtained the files from that incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

C H

title: Arrest & Use of Force (City Of Wynne Arkansas)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Date: November 3, 2023

Wynne Police Department 

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Arrest and Associated Records of Christopher Reed on 10/23/23

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the Wynne Police Department and Cross County District Court pertaining to the arrest of Christopher Reed on 10/23/23. All files in District Courts Possession including motions and request made by Mr.  Christopher Reed DOB 02/14/1980

For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:

Any written reports, arrest records, citations, or charging documents related to the incident.

Any dash camera and body-worn camera footage of the incident.

 Any radio transmissions, call logs, or dispatch records related to the incident.

Any witness statements or interview transcripts associated with the incident.

Any photos or other evidence collected as part of the investigation.

All records in possession of Cross County Detention Center including booking photos etc. 

All videos of Mr. Christopher Reed while at the Cross County Detention Center. 

Copy of complaint filed with Detention Center concerning incident. 

All personnel files, Disciplinary and Training Records 

Wynne Police Policy and Procedures Manual including Use Of Force Manual 

Cross County Sheriff Department Policy and Procedures Manual

All medical records in file

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Christopher Reed.

title: Arrest & Use of Force (Cross County District Court)

Dear FOI Officer, 

I'm enclosing my public records request here as a PDF attachment.

I imagine it's a chaotic time to be running a FOI office and as such, I am especially grateful to you for processing this request. Please let me know if you have any issues accessing the PDF that I have attached. 

In gratitude, 

Muira McCammon, PhD 
Assistant Professor
Tulane University

title: Cross County Law Enforcement FOIA Request (City Of Wynne Arkansas)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting  public records from Wynne Police Department and Cross County Sheriff Department. 

Please provide the following:

* Use of Force Policy and Procedures 

* Copy of Use of Force Reports from 2021 to Present

* All current policies and procedures maintained by the department regarding reasonable modifications for arrestees that suffering a Mental Health Crisis

* Training Requirements and Policies for dealing with citizens experiencing a mental health crisis

* Policies and Procedures for arrestees requesting medical treatment during or after time of arrest

* Provide training and personnel files for all staff working a law enforcement position, including dispatching and detention center from 2021 to present

* Policy and Procedures for transporting a person with disabilities or experiencing a mental health crisis

* Policy and Procedures for seat belt use 

* Policy and Procedures on nonemergency driving to include speed limit policy

* Copy of all Use of Force reports from 2021 to present

* Provide policy and procedures showing that the above agencies are following the condition of receiving federal financial assistance, certification that they are complying with all requirements imposed by Title VI and the federal regulations implementing Title VI regulations. 

* Provide documentation that show the above agencies receive funds from the Office of Justice Programs (“OJP”) and that they are following the requirements of the Safe Streets Act.

* Provide the number of internal affairs investigations performed from 2021 to present and list the reasoning for the investigation.

* Provide a racial breakdown of all arrest from 2020 to present and charges that accompany each arrest. 

* From Dates 2020 to Present please provide a breakdown of all arrest that was not supported by probable cause, resulting in arrestees release without charge. 

* From Dates 2020 to Present please provide a breakdown of racial and disability for all internal affairs investigations that was conducted due to complaints from citizens stating that their Constitutional Rights was violated. Also please provide the outcome of the investigation. These violations include the following:

- a. Making unconstitutional stops, searches, and arrests, in violation of the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments;

- b. Using excessive force, in violation of the Fourth Amendment.

- c. Retaliating against individuals engaging in constitutionally-protected expression, in violation of the First Amendment.

- d. Using enforcement strategies that disproportionately impact African Americans, in violation of Title VI, the Title VI implementing regulations, 28 C.F.R.§§ 42.101-112, and the Safe Streets Act and its implementing regulations.

- e. Failing to make reasonable modifications to their practices regarding the use of force against individuals with disabilities, in violation of Title II.

* Provide agencies policy and procedures for dealing with violations of the Constitution and federal law that are driven by practices that are systemic deficiencies in policies, training, supervision, and accountability structures.

* Provide a listing of all law suits filed against the agencies above from 2018 to present. 

* Provide policy and procedures for pre-arrest search of arrestee and transport patrol unit. 

* Provide policy and procedures for medical decisions at hospital of arrestee by arresting officers or supervisors. 

* Provide policy and procedures on responding to all calls of service. 

* From Dates 2019 to Present, please provide copies of all internal affairs investigation or disciplinary records of all law enforcement officers for failure to respond to a calls and dispatchers for failure to relay calls of service. 

* Provide a copy of law enforcement handbook and detention officer handbooks for each agency listed above. 

* From Dates 2020 to present please provide a racial breakdown of all staff, positions and total number of staff.  

* Provide procedures and policy for citizen complaints.

* Provide procedures to have a staff investigation referred to an unbiased agency. Example, Arkansas State Police.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Christopher Reed.
